comments.body: I think we probably want to add logic to keep higher values for the parameters on the healthcheck if the user has increased the value outside of Kubernetes. This gives the user a way out if their cluster is being impacted by the healthcheck volume.
Logic added. Unit test also added to guard the logic.
var changed bool
changed = true

Here the hc.CheckIntervalSec > newHC.CheckIntervalSec means user sets a larger interval than our default interval.
This line of code is applying the user configured value to expected HC.
The logic should be clearer now after refactoring.
changed = true
etc..
Could we still call targetPoolURL() in createForwardingRule()? Seems a bit unclean in this way...

Humm, I see why it is hard, targetPoolURL desires some info from the gce struct but there is no obvious way for `CloudForwardingRuleService` to expose those. And we need `CloudForwardingRuleService` for mocking and testing.

Never mind :/
Yep. I could fix the targetPool code too with more mocking, but I'd prefer leaving them alone for this change.
Probably log this case as well?
Done.
Log the ensured IP for debuggability?
Done.
Do we really want to wrap the error here? Alternative is to pass the error up the stack.
If `isNotFound(err)` is true, the code would continue to check whether `requestedIP == fwdRuleIP`.  Changing this may not make the logic more readable.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +437,441 @@	// case we shouldn't delete it anyway).
	existingAddress, err := s.GetRegionAddressByIP(region, requestedIP)
	if err != nil && !isNotFound(err) {
		glog.Errorf("verifyUserRequestedIP: failed to check whether the requested IP %q for LB %s exists: %v", requestedIP, lbRef, err)
		return false, err

comments.body: Hmm....I intentionally not modified the release logic (other than renaming one variable in the log message). I'd prefer the PR stay that way.
promote this to an Error.
Same as the comment before. I intentionally kept the logic here intact. I can send a separate PR later if you want all these changes.
isUserOwnedIP seems like a better name?
Do you mean to renamed `ownedByUser` to `isUserOwnedIP`? Done. Although it's not used anywhere, and it's just here for clarity.
Passing the interface via parameter is a temporary, ugly plug. One topic of discussion for us is should we separate our wrapper GCP API funcs from LB-specific funcs?
I have some thoughts on what the layer should be but out of scope for this PR most likely.
